normalised: **Five G Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – Telecom operators are accelerating 5G rollout across India, with Bharti Airtel announcing expansion to tier-2 and tier-3 cities by Q3 2024. Reliance Jio continues its aggressive deployment strategy, aiming for pan-India coverage by December 2023.
normalised: New Delhi – Telecom operators are accelerating five G rollout across India, with Bharti Airtel announcing expansion to tier two and tier three cities by Q three two thousand and twenty four. Reliance Jio continues its aggressive deployment strategy, aiming for pan India coverage by December two thousand and twenty three.

unnormalised: Industry analysts at IIM Ahmedabad project a significant boost to the Indian economy, estimating a contribution of Rs. 3.6 trillion by 2030, thanks to enhanced connectivity and IoT applications.
normalised: Industry analysts at I I M Ahmedabad project a significant boost to the Indian economy, estimating a contribution of rupee three point six trillion by two thousand and thirty, thanks to enhanced connectivity and I O T applications.

unnormalised: Vodafone Idea, though facing financial challenges, is reportedly in talks with Ericsson for network upgrades. The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) has set a deadline of 31/03/2024 for achieving significant rural connectivity targets.
normalised: Vodafone Idea, though facing financial challenges, is reportedly in talks with Ericsson for network upgrades. The Department of Telecommunications (D O T) has set a deadline of thirty first march two thousand and twenty four for achieving significant rural connectivity targets.

unnormalised: The rollout uses a mix of indigenous and foreign technologies. Concerns remain about the high cost of 5G handsets and potential health hazards. A public awareness campaign is planned by the government, starting 15/11/2023, at 11:00 hrs.
normalised: The rollout uses a mix of indigenous and foreign technologies. Concerns remain about the high cost of five G handsets and potential health hazards. A public awareness campaign is planned by the government, starting fifteenth november two thousand and twenty three, at eleven zero zero hours.

unnormalised: Early adopters in Mumbai report download speeds of up to 1 Gbps. The network deployment spans approximately 10,000 km of fibre optic cables this fiscal year alone.
normalised: Early adopters in Mumbai report download speeds of up to one G B P S. The network deployment spans approximately ten thousand kilometer of fibre optic cables this fiscal year alone.
